verses.roman:
brāhmaṇa-vaiṣṇava yata--choṭa, baḍa haya
uttama-vastu bheṭa lañā tāṅra ṭhāñi yāya

synonyms: brāhmaṇa-vaiṣṇava—Vaiṣṇavas coming from brāhmaṇa families; yata—all; choṭa—neophyte; baḍa—highly advanced; haya—are; uttama-vastu—first-class eatables; bheṭa lañā—taking as gifts; tāṅra ṭhāñi—to them; yāya—goes.
translation: He would go to all the Vaiṣṇavas born in brāhmaṇa families, be they neophyte or advanced devotees, and present them gifts of first-class eatables.
